tag.name: a
tag.help: HTML hypertext link. This tag can only occur inside XHTML text containers such as "text".

parameter.name: href
parameter.help: The link target.

parameter.name: target
parameter.help: The value of this attribute determines where the link target will be displayed. The interpretation is the same as in HTML, where the "current frame" is the frame containing the LZX application. The value must be a name beginning with an alphabetic character.

tag.name: alert
tag.help: A simple subclass of modaldialog, alert provides a modal alert box that displays its text attribute (or content) and an OK button. (If you need to display more than text in an alert, use modaldialog itself).

parameter.name: button1
parameter.help: Alert shows only this button, if button2 isn't set. Default: "OK". You may specify a different string to change the text of the button.

parameter.name: button2
parameter.help: If a string is set for this attribute, a second button will be shown to the left of the first with this text.

parameter.name: maxtextwidth
parameter.help: The max length of a line of text before it wraps. Default: 1/3 of the parent's width - width of window dressing and margin.

parameter.name: onresult
parameter.help: This event is sent when a button is pressed. Use this to check the result value.

parameter.name: text_x
parameter.help: The x position of the button text. Default: 0 (left).

parameter.name: text_y
parameter.help: The y position of the button text. Default: 0 (top).

tag.name: attribute
tag.help: Sets an attribute of the object that contains it.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: The name of the attribute.

parameter.name: value
parameter.help: The initial value of the attribute. The type of this value is specified by the value of the type attribute; if that attribute is not present, it's the type of this attribute in this element's tag. The attribute is given this value when the element is created.

parameter.name: when
parameter.help:
When the initial value expression is to be evaluated. One of: * immediately evaluate when the enclosing element is defined (must be a constant) * once evaluate when the enclosing element is initialized * always update whenever the value of the expression changes
The default is when="immediately.

parameter.name: init
parameter.help: As an alternative to the value attribute, an expression may be supplied in the init attribute. The attribute is given the value of the expression when the element is initialized.

parameter.name: constraint
parameter.help: ** Deprecated since 1.1 Use value with when='always' instead. ** As an alternative to the value attribute, an expression may be supplied in the constraint attribute. The attribute will be constrained to the value of the expression at all times.

parameter.name: type
parameter.help: The type of the attribute. This determines how the value is parsed. Attributes of type string are automatically quoted if when="immediate", for any other value of when, a literal string would have to be quoted to be used as a value.

parameter.name: required
parameter.help: True if this is a required attribute.

parameter.name: setter
parameter.help: Code that is executed when setAttribute is used to set the value of this attribute. This code is executed within a context in which the variable with this attribute's name is bound to the value passed to setAttribute.

parameter.name: onset
parameter.help: ** Deprecated since 1.1 Use setter instead. ** Code that is executed when setAttribute is used to set the value of this attribute. This code is executed within a context in which the variable with this attribute's name is bound to the value passed to setAttribute.

tag.name: audio
tag.help: Warning: This tag is obsolete. Imports an audio file. Its functionality has been replaced by the "resource" tag.

parameter.name: id
parameter.help: A unique identifier for this element. Can be used as a global variable name in JavaScript code.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: The name of a variable that will be set to this object when the application is started. If this element is directly within a "canvas" or "library" element, the global variable and the canvas property with this name will be set to this object. If this element is within another object, that object's property with this name will be set to this object.

parameter.name: src
parameter.help: The path of a file that contains the source for this object.

tag.name: b
tag.help: Bold Text. HTML bold character markup. This tag can only occur inside XHTML text containers such as "text" and "button".

tag.name: br
tag.help: Line break. HTML line break. This tag can only occur inside XHTML text containers such as "text".

tag.name: button
tag.help: The button class provides a simple pushbutton. JavaScript: button Extends Basebutton The button tag provides a simple button. The button is rectangular and typically displays a text label describing its action. The button adjusts to fit the label.

parameter.name: text_padding_x
parameter.help: the amount of space to add horizontally when sizing button to its text. default: 11

parameter.name: text_padding_y
parameter.help: the amount of space to add vertically when sizing button to its text. default: 4

parameter.name: text_x
parameter.help: the x position of the button text. default: centered

parameter.name: text_y
parameter.help: the y position of the button text. default: centered

parameter.name: disabledResourceNumber
parameter.help: The resource for the disabled state, default: 4. Use 0 if there are the resource has at least 4 frames, but there is no disabled state.

parameter.name: downResourceNumber
parameter.help: The resource for the mouse down state, default: 3. Use 0 if the resources has at least 3 frames, but there is no down state.

parameter.name: maxframes
parameter.help: The maximum number of frames to use, defaults to the number of frames for the resoruce associated with this view. This is useful for a subclass has no resource for this view. Default is the total frames of basebutton.

parameter.name: normalResourceNumber
parameter.help: The resource for the mouse up state, and initial state of the button.

parameter.name: onresourceviewcount
parameter.help: This event is sent when the resourceviewcount changes.

parameter.name: overResourceNumber
parameter.help: The resource for the mouse over state, default: 2. Use 0 if the resource has at least 2 frames, but there is no over state.

parameter.name: reference
parameter.help: Where to send mouse events (the view that will be "clickable"), default: this.

parameter.name: resourceviewcount
parameter.help: The first 'n' subviews that will respond to mouseevents by changing the frame number of their resource.

parameter.name: respondtomouseout
parameter.help: If this button does not respond to onmouseout or onmousedragout events, set this flag to false. Default: true.

parameter.name: doesenter
parameter.help: If set to true, the component manager will call this component with doEnterDown and doEnterUp when the enter key goes up or down if it is focussed.

parameter.name: enabled
parameter.help: when false the component should appear as its disabled state and not respond to user events (default: true) The component is automatically set to clickable when enabled, and not clickable when disabled.

parameter.name: hasdefault
parameter.help: set to true when this component will receive enter key events

parameter.name: isdefault
parameter.help: If set to true, this component will be the default (and will therefore receive the enter key) if it is nearest to the focussed view, and if that focussed view does not have doesenter set to true. "Nearness" is defined to mean the closest common parent with the focussed view that is not excluded from the mode, and which is visible onscreen.

parameter.name: style
parameter.help: If null, the style is set to the inherited style from the parent component, if no parent component the style will be the canvas 'defaultstyle' attribute

parameter.name: styleable
parameter.help: whether style should be applied to this component

parameter.name: text
parameter.help: the label or title of the component: instead of using this attribute text may instead be placed withing the tag

parameter.name: bgcolor
parameter.help: The color of background of this view. Null if there is no bgcolor. A number from 0 - 0xFFFFFF.

parameter.name: clickable
parameter.help: must be set to true for the view to get mouse events (auto-set to true if a mouse event script is specified in the tag)

parameter.name: clip
parameter.help: If true, the resource and children of this view are masked to its width and height.

parameter.name: cursor
parameter.help: The cursor to display when the mouse is over this view. Any resource can be used as a cursor. This attribute can be set for any view with clickable=true, or any view whose class defaults clickable to true.

parameter.name: fgcolor
parameter.help: A color to use to render object that appears inside this view, which includes any vector or bitmap art in the view's resource and any contained views.

parameter.name: focusable
parameter.help: If true, this view will participate in keyboard focus and will receive focus events and keyboard events when it has the focus. (see LzFocus for more details)

parameter.name: focustrap
parameter.help: If true, this view "traps" the focus, for example in a window or dialog. See focus manager (LzFocus) for more details.

parameter.name: font
parameter.help: The font to use for any "text" or "inputtext" elements that appear inside this view. Like all the font properties (fontstyle and fontsize too) these properties cascade down the view hierarchy until a new value is specified. When the font attributes are modified at runtime, using JavaScript, the font is changed for the view itself, not for any of its subviews.

parameter.name: fontsize
parameter.help: Pixel size to use to render text which appears inside this view. The default is 8.

parameter.name: fontstyle
parameter.help: The style to use to render text fields that appear inside of this view. Once of "plain", "bold" , "italic" or "bolditalic".

parameter.name: frame
parameter.help: See also the resource attribute. Setting this attribute will change the frame that is being displayed by the resource associated with this view. The first frame of the resource is frame 0. Setting a view's 'donttrackplay' option to true will allow the view's resource to play without updating the value of the view's frame property. This can save CPU usage in cases where the application doesn't need to know what frame the resource is showing while it is playing.

parameter.name: height
parameter.help: The height of the view

parameter.name: layout
parameter.help: A CSS property when declared in the tag: value sequence of layout parameters, which are used to create a layout that is attached to this view. If there is a class property, it names the class of the layout; otherwise simplelayout is used. Examples: axis: x, class: constantlayout; axis: y; axis: x; spacing: 5. For Javascript usage, see the setLayout method.

parameter.name: onblur
parameter.help: The onblur script is executed when an element loses focus either by the pointing device or by tabbing navigation.

parameter.name: onclick
parameter.help: The onclick script is executed when the pointing device button is clicked over an element.

parameter.name: ondata
parameter.help: The ondata script is executed when the data selected by a view's datapath changes.

parameter.name: ondblclick
parameter.help: The ondblclick script is executed when the pointing device button is double clicked over an element

parameter.name: onfocus
parameter.help: The onfocus script is executed when an element receives focus either by the pointing device or by tabbing navigation.

parameter.name: onkeydown
parameter.help: The onkeydown script is executed when this view has the focus and a key is pressed down. Multiple key down events are sent for a key that is held down. If you want the script executed only once, use onkeyup. This event is sent with the keycode for the key that is down.

parameter.name: onkeyup
parameter.help: The onkeyup script is executed when this view has the focus and a key is released. This event is sent with the keycode for the key that went up.

parameter.name: onmousedown
parameter.help: The onmousedown script is executed when the pointing device button is pressed over an element.

parameter.name: onmouseout
parameter.help: The onmouseout script is executed when the point device is moved so that is is no longer over an element.

parameter.name: onmouseover
parameter.help: The onmouseover script is executed when the pointing device is moved onto an element.

parameter.name: onmouseup
parameter.help: The onmouseup script is executed when the pointing device button is released over an element.

parameter.name: opacity
parameter.help: The opacity value for the view, a number between 0 and 1

parameter.name: options
parameter.help: A list of CSS property names and values that configure the behavior of objects, such as data binding and view layouts, that operate on this view.

parameter.name: pixellock
parameter.help: If true, values for width, height, x and y are always rounded down to the nearest integer

parameter.name: play
parameter.help: If true, the resource attached to this view begins playing when the view is instantiated.

parameter.name: resource
parameter.help: The name of this view's resource, or the URL the resource was loaded from.

parameter.name: rotation
parameter.help: The rotation value for the view (in degrees) Value may be less than zero or greater than 360.

parameter.name: stretches
parameter.help: Setting stretches causes a view to change its coordinate space so that everything it contains (resources and other views) fit exactly into the view's width and/or height. The default for this property is "none". This is used to resize a view's contents by setting its width and/or height.

parameter.name: valign
parameter.help: Creates a constraint on the view's y position which is a function of its height and its parent's height. The default for this is "top".

parameter.name: visible
parameter.help: A value of true means that this view is shown. A value of false means that this view is hidden. Setting this attribute to null means that the runtime will hide this view when: its opacity is 0, it has a datapath that does not match a node, or it is loading its media. In this case, the the value of the visible member of the view will reflect the view's current visible state. This is the default behavior for this attribute. Note that an otherwise clickable view that is not visible will have no click region will not be clickable. Also be aware that in Javascript, the && operator does not coerce values to booleans. For instance, given an expression like this: visible="a && b", if a is null, the value returned by the constraint expression will be null -- not false.

parameter.name: width
parameter.help: The width of the view

parameter.name: x
parameter.help: The x position of the view

parameter.name: xoffset
parameter.help: A value to be added to the x position of this view before drawing it. This affects the apparent rotation point of the view, as well as its apparent x position. It does not affect the view's width or its internal coordinate system.

parameter.name: xscale
parameter.help: The horizontal scaling applied to the view's resource. If xscale is set, the view stretches in its x axis. A value of 1 means that the resource will be distorted in the horizontal axis.

parameter.name: y
parameter.help: The y position for the view

parameter.name: yoffset
parameter.help: A value to be added to the y position of this view before drawing it. This affects the apparent rotation point of the view, as well as its apparent y position. It does not affect the view's width or its internal coordinate system.

parameter.name: yscale
parameter.help: The vertical scaling applied to the view's resource. If yscale is set, the view stretches in its y axis. A value of 1 means that the resource will be distorted in the vertical axis.

parameter.name: datapath
parameter.help: A pointer to the LzDatapath attached to this node, if there is one.

parameter.name: defaultplacement
parameter.help: An attribute used in container classes. If set to a non-null value, this forces this node to run its determinePlacement method for any node whose parent is this node. If the subnode has its own placement attribute, determinePlacement will be called with that value, otherwise it will be called with this value. Note that a class's defaultplacement attribute only applies to children in subclasses or in instances, not to the children of the class itself. This means that if a class and its subclass both define a defaultplacement attribute, the attribute will be set to one value before the subclass children are created and to a different one after they are created. See the determinePlacement method.

parameter.name: id
parameter.help: A global identifer for this node. If given, a pointer to this node with the given value will be placed in the global namespace

parameter.name: initstage
parameter.help: The execution of a node's init method and sending of the oninit event is under the control of its initstage attribute

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: The name for this subview. If given, then this node's parent and immediate parent will use store a pointer to this node as the given name value

parameter.name: oninit
parameter.help: The oninit script is executed once, after the element's children, if any, have been initialized.

parameter.name: placement
parameter.help: Instructions to this element's container about where it should go within the its container's internal hierarchy. See the LzNode.determinePlacement method. Defaults to the container itself.

tag.name: canvas
tag.help: The top-most view in a Laszlo application. JavaScript: LzCanvas Extends View The canvas is the container for all views within an application. The LzCanvas class represents the viewable area of the application. There is one instance of LzCanvas, named canvas. The canvas contains all views within an application.

parameter.name: debug
parameter.help: If true, the application is compiled with debugging enabled. See the Debugging chapter of the Guide for more information about debugging.

parameter.name: libraries
parameter.help: A list of names for libraries that are included in the application.

parameter.name: maxtextwidth
parameter.help: If present, specifies the maximum width in pixels of any output text field. Text which extends beyond this width will be clipped. If this attribute is omitted, it defaults to the canvas width.

parameter.name: maxtextheight
parameter.help: If present, specifies the maximum height in pixels of any output text field. Text which extends beyond this height will be clipped. If this attribute is omitted, it defaults to the canvas height.

parameter.name: title
parameter.help: The string that is used in the browser window.

parameter.name: validate
parameter.help: If false, disables validation against the schema during compilation

parameter.name: version
parameter.help: The version for this lzx app. If set below the current version, may enable backwards compatible behaviors.

parameter.name: bgcolor
parameter.help: The color of background of this view. Null if there is no bgcolor. A number from 0 - 0xFFFFFF.

parameter.name: clickable
parameter.help: must be set to true for the view to get mouse events (auto-set to true if a mouse event script is specified in the tag)

parameter.name: clip
parameter.help: If true, the resource and children of this view are masked to its width and height.

parameter.name: cursor
parameter.help: The cursor to display when the mouse is over this view. Any resource can be used as a cursor. This attribute can be set for any view with clickable=true, or any view whose class defaults clickable to true.

parameter.name: fgcolor
parameter.help: A color to use to render object that appears inside this view, which includes any vector or bitmap art in the view's resource and any contained views.

parameter.name: focusable
parameter.help: If true, this view will participate in keyboard focus and will receive focus events and keyboard events when it has the focus. (see LzFocus for more details)

parameter.name: focustrap
parameter.help: If true, this view "traps" the focus, for example in a window or dialog. See focus manager (LzFocus) for more details.

parameter.help: The font to use for any "text" or "inputtext" elements that appear inside this view. Like all the font properties (fontstyle and fontsize too) these properties cascade down the view hierarchy until a new value is specified. When the font attributes are modified at runtime, using JavaScript, the font is changed for the view itself, not for any of its subviews.

parameter.name: fontsize
parameter.help: Pixel size to use to render text which appears inside this view. The default is 8.

parameter.name: fontstyle
parameter.help: The style to use to render text fields that appear inside of this view. Once of "plain", "bold" , "italic" or "bolditalic".

parameter.name: frame
parameter.help: See also the resource attribute. Setting this attribute will change the frame that is being displayed by the resource associated with this view. The first frame of the resource is frame 0. Setting a view's 'donttrackplay' option to true will allow the view's resource to play without updating the value of the view's frame property. This can save CPU usage in cases where the application doesn't need to know what frame the resource is showing while it is playing.

parameter.name: height
parameter.help: The height of the view

parameter.name: layout
parameter.help: A CSS property when declared in the tag: value sequence of layout parameters, which are used to create a layout that is attached to this view. If there is a class property, it names the class of the layout; otherwise simplelayout is used. Examples: axis: x, class: constantlayout; axis: y; axis: x; spacing: 5. For Javascript usage, see the setLayout method.

parameter.help: The onkeyup script is executed when this view has the focus and a key is released. This event is sent with the keycode for the key that went up.

parameter.name: onmousedown
parameter.help: The onmousedown script is executed when the pointing device button is pressed over an element.

parameter.name: onmouseover
parameter.help: The onmouseover script is executed when the pointing device is moved onto an element.

parameter.name: onmouseup
parameter.help: The onmouseup script is executed when the pointing device button is released over an element.

parameter.name: play
parameter.help: If true, the resource attached to this view begins playing when the view is instantiated.

If the subnode has its own placement attribute, determinePlacement will be called with that value, otherwise it will be called with this value. This means that if a class and its subclass both define a defaultplacement attribute, the attribute will be set to one value before the subclass children are created and to a different one after they are created. parameter.name: initstage

parameter.name: placement

tag.name: checkbox
tag.help: The checkbox tag provides a simple toggle button. JavaScript: checkbox Extends Baseformitem The checkbox tag provides a simple toggle button that represents a value of true or false. It has a disabled state where it does not respond to mouse events when enabled=false.

parameter.name: value
parameter.help: the value that this item represents. When selected, the parent selection group's value will be set to this value. Most subclasses require you to call getValue() to get the value of the attribute.

parameter.name: doesenter
parameter.help: If set to true, the component manager will call this component with doEnterDown and doEnterUp when the enter key goes up or down if it is focussed.

parameter.name: enabled
parameter.help: when false the component should appear as its disabled state and not respond to user events (default: true) The component is automatically set to clickable when enabled, and not clickable when disabled.

parameter.name: hasdefault
parameter.help: set to true when this component will receive enter key events

parameter.name: isdefault
parameter.help: If set to true, this component will be the default (and will therefore receive the enter key) if it is nearest to the focussed view, and if that focussed view does not have doesenter set to true. "Nearness" is defined to mean the closest common parent with the focussed view that is not excluded from the mode, and which is visible onscreen.

parameter.name: style
parameter.help: If null, the style is set to the inherited style from the parent component, if no parent component the style will be the canvas 'defaultstyle' attribute

parameter.name: styleable
parameter.help: whether style should be applied to this component

parameter.name: text
parameter.help: the label or title of the component: instead of using this attribute text may instead be placed withing the tag

parameter.help: A CSS property when declared in the tag: value sequence of layout parameters, which are used to create a layout that is attached to this view. If there is a class property, it names the class of the layout; otherwise simplelayout is used. Examples: axis: x, class: constantlayout; axis: y; axis: x; spacing: 5. For Javascript usage, see the setLayout method.

parameter.name: onblur
parameter.help: The onblur script is executed when an element loses focus either by the pointing device or by tabbing navigation.

parameter.name: onclick
parameter.help: The onclick script is executed when the pointing device button is clicked over an element.

parameter.name: ondata
parameter.help: The ondata script is executed when the data selected by a view's datapath changes.

parameter.name: ondblclick
parameter.help: The ondblclick script is executed when the pointing device button is double clicked over an element

parameter.name: onfocus
parameter.help: The onfocus script is executed when an element receives focus either by the pointing device or by tabbing navigation.

parameter.name: onkeydown
parameter.help: The onkeydown script is executed when this view has the focus and a key is pressed down. Multiple key down events are sent for a key that is held down. If you want the script executed only once, use onkeyup. This event is sent with the keycode for the key that is down.

parameter.name: onkeyup
parameter.help: The onkeyup script is executed when this view has the focus and a key is released. This event is sent with the keycode for the key that went up.

parameter.name: onmousedown
parameter.help: The onmousedown script is executed when the pointing device button is pressed over an element.

parameter.name: onmouseout
parameter.help: The onmouseout script is executed when the point device is moved so that is is no longer over an element.

parameter.name: onmouseover
parameter.help: The onmouseover script is executed when the pointing device is moved onto an element.

parameter.name: onmouseup
parameter.help: The onmouseup script is executed when the pointing device button is released over an element.

parameter.name: opacity
parameter.help: The opacity value for the view, a number between 0 and 1

parameter.name: options
parameter.help: A list of CSS property names and values that configure the behavior of objects, such as data binding and view layouts, that operate on this view.

parameter.name: pixellock
parameter.help: If true, values for width, height, x and y are always rounded down to the nearest integer

parameter.name: play
parameter.help: If true, the resource attached to this view begins playing when the view is instantiated.

parameter.name: resource
parameter.help: The name of this view's resource, or the URL the resource was loaded from.

parameter.name: rotation
parameter.help: The rotation value for the view (in degrees) Value may be less than zero or greater than 360.

parameter.name: stretches
parameter.help: Setting stretches causes a view to change its coordinate space so that everything it contains (resources and other views) fit exactly into the view's width and/or height. The default for this property is "none". This is used to resize a view's contents by setting its width and/or height.

parameter.name: valign
parameter.help: Creates a constraint on the view's y position which is a function of its height and its parent's height. The default for this is "top".

parameter.name: visible
parameter.help: A value of true means that this view is shown. A value of false means that this view is hidden. Setting this attribute to null means that the runtime will hide this view when: its opacity is 0, it has a datapath that does not match a node, or it is loading its media. In this case, the the value of the visible member of the view will reflect the view's current visible state. This is the default behavior for this attribute. Note that an otherwise clickable view that is not visible will have no click region will not be clickable. Also be aware that in Javascript, the && operator does not coerce values to booleans. For instance, given an expression like this: visible="a && b", if a is null, the value returned by the constraint expression will be null -- not false.

parameter.name: width
parameter.help: The width of the view

parameter.name: x
parameter.help: The x position of the view

parameter.name: xoffset
parameter.help: A value to be added to the x position of this view before drawing it. This affects the apparent rotation point of the view, as well as its apparent x position. It does not affect the view's width or its internal coordinate system.

parameter.name: xscale
parameter.help: The horizontal scaling applied to the view's resource. If xscale is set, the view stretches in its x axis. A value of 1 means that the resource will be distorted in the horizontal axis.

parameter.name: y
parameter.help: The y position for the view

parameter.name: yoffset
parameter.help: A value to be added to the y position of this view before drawing it. This affects the apparent rotation point of the view, as well as its apparent y position. It does not affect the view's width or its internal coordinate system.

parameter.name: yscale
parameter.help: The vertical scaling applied to the view's resource. If yscale is set, the view stretches in its y axis. A value of 1 means that the resource will be distorted in the vertical axis.

parameter.name: datapath
parameter.help: A pointer to the LzDatapath attached to this node, if there is one.

parameter.name: defaultplacement
parameter.help: An attribute used in container classes. If set to a non-null value, this forces this node to run its determinePlacement method for any node whose parent is this node. If the subnode has its own placement attribute, determinePlacement will be called with that value, otherwise it will be called with this value. Note that a class's defaultplacement attribute only applies to children in subclasses or in instances, not to the children of the class itself. This means that if a class and its subclass both define a defaultplacement attribute, the attribute will be set to one value before the subclass children are created and to a different one after they are created. See the determinePlacement method.

parameter.name: id
parameter.help: A global identifer for this node. If given, a pointer to this node with the given value will be placed in the global namespace

parameter.name: initstage
parameter.help: The execution of a node's init method and sending of the oninit event is under the control of its initstage attribute

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: The name for this subview. If given, then this node's parent and immediate parent will use store a pointer to this node as the given name value

parameter.name: oninit
parameter.help: The oninit script is executed once, after the element's children, if any, have been initialized.

parameter.name: placement
parameter.help: Instructions to this element's container about where it should go within the its container's internal hierarchy. See the LzNode.determinePlacement method. Defaults to the container itself.

tag.name: class
tag.help: Defining your own tags. The class tag defines a new tag, which be used anywhere in the source file where a built-in tag such as view or layout can be used. Defines a new XML tag name, that can be used in the remainder of the application source. An element whose name is this tag name will inherit the attributes and content of this definition.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: The name of a new tag that this element defines.

parameter.name: extends
parameter.help: The name of the tag that this tag extends.

tag.name: combobox
tag.help: combobox displays a dropdown list of selectable items. JavaScript: combobox Extends Basecombobox A combobox is a common UI element for displaying a pop-up list associated with a text field. The selected text of the combobox is displayed within the text field. This field is an LzInputText field if the editable of the combobox is true (the default), or a static LzText field if it is false.

parameter.name: attachoffset
parameter.help: The vertical offset of the floatinglist attached to this combobox.

parameter.name: autoscrollbar
parameter.help: Whether a scrollbar should automatically show up when there are more items than shownitems.

parameter.name: bordersize
parameter.help: The border size ( in pixels ) of the popup list.

parameter.name: dataoption
parameter.help: One of "lazy", "resize", "pooling", "none".

parameter.name: defaultselection
parameter.help: The number of the item that is initially selected. This overrides the value defined in the defaulttext attribute

parameter.name: defaulttext
parameter.help: The text that appears in the text field when no item is selected.

parameter.name: editable
parameter.help: Make the text field of this combobox editable.

parameter.name: isopen
parameter.help: Indicates whether or not the popup list is showing.

parameter.name: itemclassname
parameter.help: The class that is used to create an item in the list when itemdatapath is assigned.

parameter.name: ondefaultselection
parameter.help: This event is sent when the default selection is set.

parameter.name: shownitems
parameter.help: Sets the height of the combobox to show 'n' items.

parameter.name: spacing
parameter.help: The spacing size ( in pixels ) between items in the pop-up list.

parameter.name: text_width
parameter.help: the width the text. default: combowidth - 19

parameter.name: text_x
parameter.help: the x position of the text. default: 2

parameter.name: text_y
parameter.help: the y position of the text. default: 2

parameter.name: value
parameter.help: the value that this item represents. When selected, the parent selection group's value will be set to this value. Most subclasses require you to call getValue() to get the value of the attribute.

parameter.name: doesenter
parameter.help: If set to true, the component manager will call this component with doEnterDown and doEnterUp when the enter key goes up or down if it is focussed.

parameter.name: enabled
parameter.help: when false the component should appear as its disabled state and not respond to user events (default: true) The component is automatically set to clickable when enabled, and not clickable when disabled.

parameter.name: hasdefault
parameter.help: set to true when this component will receive enter key events

parameter.name: isdefault
parameter.help: If set to true, this component will be the default (and will therefore receive the enter key) if it is nearest to the focussed view, and if that focussed view does not have doesenter set to true. "Nearness" is defined to mean the closest common parent with the focussed view that is not excluded from the mode, and which is visible onscreen.

parameter.name: style
parameter.help: If null, the style is set to the inherited style from the parent component, if no parent component the style will be the canvas 'defaultstyle' attribute

parameter.name: styleable
parameter.help: whether style should be applied to this component

parameter.name: text
parameter.help: the label or title of the component: instead of using this attribute text may instead be placed withing the tag

parameter.name: bgcolor
parameter.help: The color of background of this view. Null if there is no bgcolor. A number from 0 - 0xFFFFFF.

parameter.name: clickable
parameter.help: must be set to true for the view to get mouse events (auto-set to true if a mouse event script is specified in the tag)

parameter.name: clip
parameter.help: If true, the resource and children of this view are masked to its width and height.

parameter.name: cursor
parameter.help: The cursor to display when the mouse is over this view. Any resource can be used as a cursor. This attribute can be set for any view with clickable=true, or any view whose class defaults clickable to true.

parameter.name: fgcolor
parameter.help: A color to use to render object that appears inside this view, which includes any vector or bitmap art in the view's resource and any contained views.

parameter.name: focusable
parameter.help: If true, this view will participate in keyboard focus and will receive focus events and keyboard events when it has the focus. (see LzFocus for more details)

parameter.name: focustrap
parameter.help: If true, this view "traps" the focus, for example in a window or dialog. See focus manager (LzFocus) for more details.

parameter.name: font
parameter.help: The font to use for any "text" or "inputtext" elements that appear inside this view. Like all the font properties (fontstyle and fontsize too) these properties cascade down the view hierarchy until a new value is specified. When the font attributes are modified at runtime, using JavaScript, the font is changed for the view itself, not for any of its subviews.

parameter.name: fontsize
parameter.help: Pixel size to use to render text which appears inside this view. The default is 8.

parameter.name: fontstyle
parameter.help: The style to use to render text fields that appear inside of this view. Once of "plain", "bold" , "italic" or "bolditalic".

parameter.name: frame
parameter.help: See also the resource attribute. Setting this attribute will change the frame that is being displayed by the resource associated with this view. The first frame of the resource is frame 0. Setting a view's 'donttrackplay' option to true will allow the view's resource to play without updating the value of the view's frame property. This can save CPU usage in cases where the application doesn't need to know what frame the resource is showing while it is playing.

parameter.name: height
parameter.help: The height of the view

parameter.name: layout
parameter.help: A CSS property when declared in the tag: value sequence of layout parameters, which are used to create a layout that is attached to this view. If there is a class property, it names the class of the layout; otherwise simplelayout is used. Examples: axis: x, class: constantlayout; axis: y; axis: x; spacing: 5. For Javascript usage, see the setLayout method.

parameter.name: onclick
parameter.help: The onclick script is executed when the pointing device button is clicked over an element.

parameter.name: x

parameter.name: xoffset

parameter.name: y

parameter.name: yoffset

parameter.name: yscale
parameter.help: The vertical scaling applied to the view's resource. If yscale is set, the view stretches in its y axis. A value of 1 means that the resource will be distorted in the vertical axis.

If the subnode has its own placement attribute, determinePlacement will be called with that value, otherwise it will be called with this value. tag.name: command
tag.help: An element that sends events in response to keyboard input. JavaScript: LzCommand Extends Node

parameter.name: active
parameter.help: true if the command is currently active. The default is true.

parameter.name: key
parameter.help: Use setAttribute or setKeys to set the group of keys associated with this command from JavaScript. For example: setAttribute('key', ['a', 'shift']) or setKeys(['j', 'control'])

parameter.name: datapath
parameter.help: A pointer to the LzDatapath attached to this node, if there is one.

parameter.name: defaultplacement

If the subnode has its own placement attribute, determinePlacement will be called with that value, otherwise it will be called with this value. This means that if a class and its subclass both define a defaultplacement attribute, the attribute will be set to one value before the subclass children are created and to a different one after they are created. tag.name: connection
tag.help: A connection manager to create a persistent connection and an authenticated session. JavaScript: LzConnection Extends Datasource The connection tag instantiates a connection manager object that handles asynchronous messages sent from the Laszlo Presentation Server. Use the the LzConnection.connect method to establish a persistent connection and disconnect to close it down.

parameter.name: authenticator
parameter.help: Class name of server-side java authenticator

parameter.name: authparam
parameter.help: Authenticator parameters.

parameter.name: group
parameter.help: Connection group name.

parameter.name: heartbeat
parameter.help: The interval value in milliseconds that the server will send a message to the application to ensure the connection is kept alive by the client. The default value of a heartbeat is 5000 milliseconds.

parameter.name: onconnect
parameter.help: The onconnect script is executed when the application is connected.

parameter.name: ondata
parameter.help: The ondata script is executed when the application receives a persistent connection message.

parameter.name: ondisconnect
parameter.help: The ondisconnect script is executed whenever the application disconnects.

parameter.name: onerror
parameter.help: The onerror script is executed whenever there's a connection failure.

parameter.name: ontimeout
parameter.help: The ontimeout script is executed whenever a timeout is encountered with the persistent connection.

parameter.name: onuserdisconnect
parameter.help: The onuserdisconnect script is executed whenever a user disconnects. See the receiveuserdisconnect attribute.

parameter.name: receiveuserdisconnect
parameter.help: Tells server to send an onuserdisconnect event every time a user disconnects. Default is false.

parameter.name: secure
parameter.help: If true, creates a secure persistent connection through https. Otherwise the connection uses http.

parameter.name: secureport
parameter.help: If true, creates a secure persistent connection through https. Otherwise the connection uses http.

parameter.name: datapath
parameter.help: A pointer to the LzDatapath attached to this node, if there is one.

parameter.name: defaultplacement

JavaScript: LzConnectionDatasource Extends Datasource Use the connectiondatasource tag to declare the datasets that handle will handle the incoming data from a connection. Unlike the connection tag, the connectiondatasource tag can be declared in libraries.

tag.name: layout
tag.help: Abstract layout base class. JavaScript: LzLayout Extends Node This layout class is the base class that all other layouts such as, for example simplelayout and resizelayout extend. A layout arranges the views within the element that it is attached to. simplelayout is one example of a basic extension of this layout object

parameter.name: locked
parameter.help: Set to true if layout is locked from updates.

parameter.name: datapath
parameter.help: A pointer to the LzDatapath attached to this node, if there is one.

tag.name: constantboundslayout
tag.help: Arranges a set of views to a constant 'x' or 'y' value with a bounding rect JavaScript: constantboundslayout Extends Layout A view can have an xoffset and a yoffset. These offsets allow the view to be placed relative to the point (xoffset, yoffset). (Otherwise the view is placed using the view's top left corner as a reference point.) If a view has an offset, then this will effect how layouts position it relative to other views.

parameter.name: axis
parameter.help: The axis in which this layout operates either 'x' or 'y'.

parameter.name: value
parameter.help: The constant value that is applied to the attribute ( defined in 'axis' as 'x' or 'y' ) of each subview in the layout.

parameter.name: locked
parameter.help: Set to true if layout is locked from updates.

parameter.help: The execution of a node's init method and sending of the oninit event is under the control of its initstage attribute

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: The name for this subview. If given, then this node's parent and immediate parent will use store a pointer to this node as the given name value

parameter.name: oninit
parameter.help: The oninit script is executed once, after the element's children, if any, have been initialized.

parameter.name: placement
parameter.help: Instructions to this element's container about where it should go within the its container's internal hierarchy. See the LzNode.determinePlacement method. Defaults to the container itself.

tag.name: constantlayout
tag.help: Arranges a set of views to a constant 'x' or 'y' value. JavaScript: constantlayout Extends Layout constantlayout extends LzLayout, and therefore it is responsible for arranging all of the subviews for the view that it is attached to. The attributes of a view that constantlayout effects are the x and y values, and as its name implies constantlayout sets all of the subviews to the same value.

parameter.name: axis
parameter.help: The axis in which this layout operates either 'x' or 'y'.

parameter.name: value
parameter.help: The constant value that is applied to the attribute ( defined in 'axis' as 'x' or 'y' ) of each subview in the layout.

parameter.name: locked
parameter.help: Set to true if layout is locked from updates.

parameter.name: datapath
parameter.help: A pointer to the LzDatapath attached to this node, if there is one.

parameter.name: defaultplacement
parameter.help: An attribute used in container classes. If set to a non-null value, this forces this node to run its determinePlacement method for any node whose parent is this node. If the subnode has its own placement attribute, determinePlacement will be called with that value, otherwise it will be called with this value. Note that a class's defaultplacement attribute only applies to children in subclasses or in instances, not to the children of the class itself. This means that if a class and its subclass both define a defaultplacement attribute, the attribute will be set to one value before the subclass children are created and to a different one after they are created. See the determinePlacement method.

parameter.name: id
parameter.help: A global identifer for this node. If given, a pointer to this node with the given value will be placed in the global namespace

parameter.name: initstage
parameter.help: The execution of a node's init method and sending of the oninit event is under the control of its initstage attribute

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: The name for this subview. If given, then this node's parent and immediate parent will use store a pointer to this node as the given name value

parameter.name: oninit
parameter.help: The oninit script is executed once, after the element's children, if any, have been initialized.

parameter.name: placement
parameter.help: Instructions to this element's container about where it should go within the its container's internal hierarchy. See the LzNode.determinePlacement method. Defaults to the container itself.

tag.name: datapointer
tag.help: A cursor in a dataset. JavaScript: LzDatapointer Extends Node A datapointer is an object that represents a pointer to a node in a LzDataset. The datapointer can be repositioned using either cursor movements calls such as selectNext, or by running an XPath request via setXPath.

parameter.name: p
parameter.help: The LzDataNode that the datapointer is pointing to. Calling setAttribute on attribute calls LzDatapointer.setPointer.

parameter.name: rerunxpath
parameter.help: If true, re-evaluate the XPath expression when the dataset is edited. Defaults to false.

parameter.name: spacing
parameter.help: This controls the spacing between elements if lazy replication is true.

parameter.name: datapath
parameter.help: A pointer to the LzDatapath attached to this node, if there is one.

parameter.name: defaultplacement
parameter.help: An attribute used in container classes. If set to a non-null value, this forces this node to run its determinePlacement method for any node whose parent is this node. If the subnode has its own placement attribute, determinePlacement will be called with that value, otherwise it will be called with this value. Note that a class's defaultplacement attribute only applies to children in subclasses or in instances, not to the children of the class itself. This means that if a class and its subclass both define a defaultplacement attribute, the attribute will be set to one value before the subclass children are created and to a different one after they are created. See the determinePlacement method.

parameter.name: placement
parameter.help: Instructions to this element's container about where it should go within the its container's internal hierarchy. See the LzNode.determinePlacement method. Defaults to the container itself.

tag.name: datapath
tag.help: The binder between data and nodes. JavaScript: LzDatapath Extends Datapointer Datapaths are used to merge data hierarchies with the hierarchy of a Laszlo application. This is done using the the XPath syntax supported by LzDatapointer. When a node is given a datapath attribute, a datapath with the given value as its XPath is created. If the datapath retrieves a node (i.e. it doesn't terminate in an attribute getter or a () operator) then the node is mapped to that data context and all child nodes will implicitly share the datacontext, but no further action is taken.

parameter.name: pooling
parameter.help: This attribute applies to datapaths which match multiple nodes and force replication. See the section on Pooling in the Guide for information about the use of this attribute.

parameter.name: pooling
parameter.help: Determines whether to use normal or lazy replication, if the datapath matches more than one node. See the section on Replication in the Guide for information about the use of this attribute.

parameter.name: sortorder
parameter.help: The order to use to sort the dataset if replication occurs. One of ascending or descending to use built in dictionary sort, or a function which compares two strings and returns 1 if the strings are in order, 0 if they are the same, and -1 if they are out of order.

parameter.name: sortpath
parameter.help: An XPath to use to obtain the sort key for sorting if replication occurs.

parameter.name: p
parameter.help: The LzDataNode that the datapointer is pointing to. Calling setAttribute on attribute calls LzDatapointer.setPointer.

parameter.name: rerunxpath
parameter.help: If true, re-evaluate the XPath expression when the dataset is edited. Defaults to false.

parameter.name: spacing
parameter.help: This controls the spacing between elements if lazy replication is true.

parameter.name: datapath
parameter.help: A pointer to the LzDatapath attached to this node, if there is one.

parameter.name: defaultplacement

If the subnode has its own placement attribute, determinePlacement will be called with that value, otherwise it will be called with this value. Note that a class's defaultplacement attribute only applies to children in subclasses or in instances, not to the children of the class itself. This means that if a class and its subclass both define a defaultplacement attribute, the attribute will be set to one value before the subclass children are created and to a different one after they are created. See the determinePlacement method.

tag.name: selectionmanager
tag.help: Manages selection among a series of objects. JavaScript: LzSelectionManager Extends Node Selection managers manage selection among a series of objects. They enable standard control and shift click modifiers to aid range selection. Selection managers provide methods to manipulate, add to and clear the selection.

parameter.name: toggle
parameter.help: If true, a re-selected element will lose the selection.

parameter.name: datapath
parameter.help: A pointer to the LzDatapath attached to this node, if there is one.

parameter.name: defaultplacement
parameter.help: An attribute used in container classes. If set to a non-null value, this forces this node to run its determinePlacement method for any node whose parent is this node. If the subnode has its own placement attribute, determinePlacement will be called with that value, otherwise it will be called with this value. Note that a class's defaultplacement attribute only applies to children in subclasses or in instances, not to the children of the class itself. This means that if a class and its subclass both define a defaultplacement attribute, the attribute will be set to one value before the subclass children are created and to a different one after they are created. See the determinePlacement method.

parameter.name: placement
parameter.help: Instructions to this element's container about where it should go within the its container's internal hierarchy. See the LzNode.determinePlacement method. Defaults to the container itself.

tag.name: dataselectionmanager
tag.help: A selection manager for views generated by a lazily-replicated datapath JavaScript: LzDataSelectionManager Extends Selectionmanager If a datapath's datapath.replication attribute is set to "lazy", then a match to multiple nodes will create an LzLazyReplicationManager instead of an LzReplicationManager. The lazy replication manager creates only enough replicated views in order to display the data, so there is not a view for each data node. This enables the display of very large datasets.

parameter.name: toggle
parameter.help: If true, a re-selected element will lose the selection.

parameter.name: datapath
parameter.help: A pointer to the LzDatapath attached to this node, if there is one.

parameter.name: defaultplacement
parameter.help: An attribute used in container classes. If set to a non-null value, this forces this node to run its determinePlacement method for any node whose parent is this node. If the subnode has its own placement attribute, determinePlacement will be called with that value, otherwise it will be called with this value. Note that a class's defaultplacement attribute only applies to children in subclasses or in instances, not to the children of the class itself. This means that if a class and its subclass both define a defaultplacement attribute, the attribute will be set to one value before the subclass children are created and to a different one after they are created. See the determinePlacement method.

parameter.name: placement
parameter.help: Instructions to this element's container about where it should go within the its container's internal hierarchy. See the LzNode.determinePlacement method. Defaults to the container itself.

tag.name: dataset
tag.help: An in-memory xml-style data hierarchy. JavaScript: LzDataset Extends LzDataElement A dataset tag within a canvas or library element defines a local dataset. The name of the dataset is used in the datapath attribute of a view. The src attribute of the dataset element specifies whether the data is compiled into the application or fetched at runtime

parameter.name: acceptencodings
parameter.help: When true, the server will accept encoded responses for this request. Encoded responses require more work for the LPS (encoding the response) and client (decoding the response) in trade for lower network bandwidth usage.

parameter.name: autorequest
parameter.help: ** Deprecated since 1.1 Use the request attribute instead. **

parameter.name: getresponseheaders
parameter.help: When true, the server will encode and send the HTTP response headers along with the data (defaults to false).

parameter.name: ondata
parameter.help: Sent when new data arrives for this dataset

parameter.name: onerror
parameter.help: Sent when an error occurs for this dataset

parameter.name: ontimeout
parameter.help: Sent when a request times out

parameter.name: port
parameter.help: ** Deprecated since 1.1 Use the secureport attribute instead. ** Sets the port number to use to connect to the LPS for a secure connection.

parameter.name: querystring
parameter.help: A string to be appended to the request that the dataset makes.

parameter.name: queuerequests
parameter.help: If true, the client should ensure that each request is made, rather than just making and reporting the last request.

parameter.name: request
parameter.help: If true, the datset will make a request when it inits. The default for this is false.

parameter.name: secure
parameter.help: specifies whether or not the app-LPS connection is secure

parameter.name: secureport
parameter.help: Sets the port number to use to connect to the LPS for a secure connection.

parameter.name: src
parameter.help: The source for requests made by this dataset.

parameter.name: type
parameter.help: If set to "http", then the dataset will interpret its src attribute as an url from which to load its content, rather than as a static xml file to inline.

parameter.name: datapath
parameter.help: A pointer to the LzDatapath attached to this node, if there is one.

parameter.name: defaultplacement
parameter.help: An attribute used in container classes. If set to a non-null value, this forces this node to run its determinePlacement method for any node whose parent is this node. If the subnode has its own placement attribute, determinePlacement will be called with that value, otherwise it will be called with this value. Note that a class's defaultplacement attribute only applies to children in subclasses or in instances, not to the children of the class itself. This means that if a class and its subclass both define a defaultplacement attribute, the attribute will be set to one value before the subclass children are created and to a different one after they are created. See the determinePlacement method.

parameter.help: A global identifer for this node. If given, a pointer to this node with the given value will be placed in the global namespace

parameter.name: placement
parameter.help: Instructions to this element's container about where it should go within the its container's internal hierarchy. See the LzNode.determinePlacement method. Defaults to the container itself.

tag.name: datasource
tag.help: A way of representing a server-side HTTP datasource. JavaScript: LzHTTPDatasource Extends Datasource The datasource tag is an optional way of representing a server side datasource. The datasource's parameters can specify ways in which the client is will make backend requests. Also, more than one dataset can share a datasource, and the datasource can be used to control session related information.

parameter.name: port
parameter.help: ** Deprecated since 1.1 ** Use the dataset secureport attribute instead.

parameter.name: datapath
parameter.help: A pointer to the LzDatapath attached to this node, if there is one.

parameter.name: defaultplacement
parameter.help: An attribute used in container classes. If set to a non-null value, this forces this node to run its determinePlacement method for any node whose parent is this node. If the subnode has its own placement attribute, determinePlacement will be called with that value, otherwise it will be called with this value. Note that a class's defaultplacement attribute only applies to children in subclasses or in instances, not to the children of the class itself. This means that if a class and its subclass both define a defaultplacement attribute, the attribute will be set to one value before the subclass children are created and to a different one after they are created. See the determinePlacement method.

parameter.name: oninit
